definitions: relating to or involving the theological study of Christ's person, nature, and role in salvation
examples: The seminary offered several christological courses this semester
Medieval artists often depicted christological themes in their paintings

definitions: extremely dark, gloomy, or obscure like the mythical land of perpetual darkness
examples: The cimmerian depths of the cave frightened the explorers
She wrote about the cimmerian atmosphere of industrial cities

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the working-class dialect and culture of East London
examples: His cockney accent made him instantly recognizable
The film featured authentic cockney rhyming slang throughout

definitions: existing in large amounts or flowing freely and abundantly
examples: She took copious notes during the important lecture
The storm brought copious amounts of rain to the region

definitions: having the reddish-brown color or metallic appearance of copper
examples: Her coppery hair gleamed in the autumn sunlight
The artist used coppery tones to paint the sunset

definitions: protected by copyright law from unauthorized reproduction or distribution
examples: The copyrighted material cannot be used without permission
All copyrighted images require proper attribution and licensing

definitions: having the pinkish-orange color characteristic of coral reef organisms
examples: She wore a beautiful coral dress to the party
The coral lipstick complemented her warm skin tone

definitions: fastened or bound with cords or rope
having raised ridges resembling cords, especially in fabric or muscle
examples: The corded packages were ready for shipping
He wrapped the corded telephone around his finger
His corded muscles showed years of physical training
The corded velvet fabric had a distinctive texture

definitions: warmly friendly and polite in manner or speech
examples: The host gave us a cordial welcome at the door
Their cordial relationship made business negotiations much easier

definitions: operating without a cord or wire connection, typically using batteries
examples: The cordless phone allowed her to walk around freely
Modern cordless tools make home repairs much more convenient

definitions: having the light, spongy texture or appearance characteristic of cork
examples: The tree bark had a corky texture beneath fingertips
Wine enthusiasts avoid bottles with corky, contaminated flavors

definitions: relating to or affecting the transparent front layer of the eye
examples: The patient needed corneal transplant surgery to restore vision
Corneal abrasions can be extremely painful but usually heal quickly

definitions: preserved or cured with coarse grains of salt or brine
examples: Traditional corned beef takes several days to prepare
The deli served delicious corned beef sandwiches on rye

definitions: forced into a position with no escape route available
having a specified number or type of corners or angles
examples: The cornered animal became defensive and aggressive
She felt cornered by their relentless questioning
He preferred the three-cornered hat for historical reenactments
The cornered design made the table fit perfectly

definitions: excessively sentimental, old-fashioned, or lacking in subtlety
examples: His corny jokes made everyone groan at dinner
The movie's corny dialogue ruined an otherwise good plot

definitions: relating to or denoting the arteries that supply blood to the heart
examples: The patient underwent coronary bypass surgery last month
Regular exercise helps prevent coronary artery disease

definitions: relating to or affecting the human body rather than the spirit
examples: The school banned corporal punishment decades ago
Medieval beliefs often separated corporal and spiritual experiences

definitions: having a physical material body rather than being spiritual or ethereal
examples: Ghosts were believed to lack corporeal form entirely
The artist represented abstract ideas in corporeal sculptures

definitions: having been made accurate or right by removing mistakes or faults
examples: The corrected version of the manuscript was finally published
Students received their corrected exams with detailed feedback

definitions: relating to or intended for the punishment and rehabilitation of criminals
examples: He worked as a guard at the correctional facility
The correctional system focuses on rehabilitation over pure punishment

definitions: designed to correct or counteract something harmful or undesirable
examples: She wore corrective lenses to improve her vision
The company took corrective action after the safety audit

definitions: having a mutual relationship or connection in which one thing affects another
examples: The correlate factors in the study showed interesting patterns
Scientists found correlate changes in temperature and plant growth

definitions: having a mutual relationship where changes in one correspond to changes in another
examples: Income levels are strongly correlated with educational achievement
The correlated data revealed surprising connections between variables

definitions: having a mutual or reciprocal relation such that one implies or complements the other
examples: Rights and responsibilities are correlative concepts in democracy
The correlative conjunctions connected the two independent clauses

definitions: having a close similarity, connection, or equivalence to something else
examples: Each number has a corresponding letter in the code
The corresponding increase in sales justified the marketing investment

definitions: gradually destroyed or worn away by chemical action, especially oxidation
examples: The corroded pipes needed immediate replacement to prevent leaks
Years of saltwater exposure left the metal heavily corroded

definitions: having the quality of gradually destroying or damaging something through chemical action
examples: The corrosive chemicals required special handling and storage
His corrosive criticism destroyed team morale over time

definitions: shaped into a series of parallel ridges and grooves for strength
examples: The corrugated cardboard provided excellent protection for shipping
Rain drummed loudly on the corrugated metal roof

definitions: having been made morally depraved or dishonest through improper influence
changed from original form through damage, decay, or unauthorized alteration
examples: The corrupted officials were finally brought to justice
Power had thoroughly corrupted the once-idealistic politician
The corrupted files could not be opened or recovered
Ancient texts were often corrupted through centuries of copying

definitions: having a harmful effect on morals, honesty, or integrity
examples: Parents worried about the corrupting influence of violent media
The corrupting power of wealth became evident over time

definitions: relating to the outer layer of an organ, especially the brain
examples: The cortical regions control higher-level thinking and planning
Cortical blindness results from damage to visual processing areas

definitions: affecting only the appearance of something rather than its substance or function
examples: The renovations were purely cosmetic and didn't address structural issues
She made cosmetic changes to her resume before applying

definitions: relating to the universe or cosmos, especially as distinct from earth
examples: Scientists study cosmic radiation from distant galaxies
The movie explored cosmic themes of existence and meaning

definitions: relating to the science of the origin and development of the universe
examples: The cosmological constant puzzles theoretical physicists to this day
Ancient cultures developed their own cosmological explanations for existence

definitions: familiar with and at ease in many different countries and cultures
examples: Her cosmopolitan outlook came from years of international travel
The cosmopolitan city attracted visitors from around the globe

definitions: requiring much money or causing significant loss or sacrifice
examples: The costly mistake set the project back several months
Designer clothing can be extremely costly but well-made

definitions: dressed in clothing worn to portray a character or for special occasions
examples: Costumed performers entertained children at the birthday party
The costumed actors stayed in character throughout the event

definitions: giving a feeling of comfort, warmth, and relaxation in a small space
examples: The cosy cottage provided perfect shelter from winter storms
They enjoyed cosy evenings by the fireplace together

definitions: able to be counted as individual units rather than measured as mass
examples: Books and chairs are countable nouns in English grammar
The countable votes determined the final election results

definitions: having an equal opposing weight or force that creates equilibrium
examples: The sculpture's design was carefully counterbalanced to prevent tipping
Increased costs were counterbalanced by higher productivity gains

definitions: moving in the opposite direction to the way clock hands move
examples: Turn the lid counterclockwise to open the jar
The dancers moved counterclockwise around the maypole

definitions: relating to or expressing what has not happened or is not the case
examples: Historians often explore counterfactual scenarios like different war outcomes
The counterfactual argument ignored the actual evidence presented

definitions: made in exact imitation of something valuable with intention to deceive
examples: The counterfeit bills were nearly impossible to detect
She spotted the counterfeit designer handbag immediately

definitions: contrary to what one would intuitively expect or predict to be true
examples: The counterintuitive solution actually worked better than expected
Many scientific discoveries seem counterintuitive at first glance

definitions: extending or occurring throughout a whole country or nation
examples: The countrywide protests demanded immediate government action
They launched a countrywide campaign to raise awareness

definitions: extending throughout or affecting all parts of a county
examples: The countywide election will determine the new sheriff
Countywide budget cuts affected all public schools equally

definitions: connected or combined together physically, functionally, or in occurrence
examples: The coupled train cars traveled across the country
Success was coupled with increased responsibility and pressure

definitions: showing mental or moral strength to face danger, fear, or difficulty
examples: The courageous firefighter rescued children from the burning building
It was courageous of her to speak against injustice

definitions: showing polite respect and consideration for others in behavior or speech
examples: The courteous staff made our hotel stay very pleasant
Always be courteous when dealing with customer complaints

definitions: having refined manners and elegant behavior associated with royal courts
examples: His courtly bow impressed everyone at the formal reception
The novel depicted courtly love in medieval times
